description: Physical therapy guidelines, exercise form, and rehabilitation safety

danger_signatures.message: Loaded spinal flexion dramatically increases disc herniation risk. Keep neutral spine under load.
Knee valgus (inward collapse) increases ACL tear risk by 4x. Keep knees tracking over toes.
Behind-neck movements stress shoulder capsule and cervical spine. Use front variations instead.
Ballistic/bouncing stretches can cause muscle tears. Use slow, controlled static stretches.

danger_signatures.pattern: full sit.?up|anchored sit.?up|straight leg sit.?up|hands behind (head|neck).*sit.?up
danger_signatures.message: Full sit-ups stress lumbar discs and hip flexors. Crunches or dead bugs are safer alternatives.
Training without warmup increases injury risk 2-5x. Always warm up 5-10 minutes.

danger_signatures.pattern: max(ing)? out|1.?rep max without|heaviest.*(ever|possible)|ego lift|too heavy.*form
danger_signatures.message: Lifting too heavy with poor form causes acute injuries. Progress gradually with proper form.
Loaded neck rotation can damage cervical vertebrae and discs. Avoid weighted neck circles.
Upright rows cause shoulder impingement. Use face pulls or lateral raises instead.
Hyperextension stresses joints and ligaments. Maintain slight bend at end range.

danger_signatures.pattern: ass to grass.*beginner|atg squat.*no mobility|deep squat.*heels (lift|up)
danger_signatures.message: Deep squats require adequate ankle/hip mobility. Build mobility before depth.
Kipping movements stress shoulders and can cause labrum tears. Master strict form first.
Post-surgical exercise requires medical clearance and proper progression. Consult your PT.

danger_signatures.pattern: exercise through (the )?pain|no pain no gain|push through.*(injury|pain)|ignore.*pain
danger_signatures.message: Pain is a warning signal. 'No pain no gain' causes injuries. Discomfort ‚â† sharp pain.
Breath holding raises blood pressure dangerously. Use controlled breathing pattern.
Heavy lifting on unstable surfaces increases injury risk with minimal benefit.
Heavy bench press and squats require spotters or safety bars. Gym deaths occur from failed lifts.

danger_signatures.pattern: every day.*(same muscle|train)|no rest day|train (7|seven) days|overtraining
danger_signatures.message: Muscles need 48-72 hours recovery. Overtraining leads to injury and regression.

safe_practices: Progress weight gradually (5-10% per week max)
Use full range of motion with control
Rest 48-72 hours between training same muscle
Stop if you feel sharp pain
Use spotters for heavy compound lifts
Focus on form before adding weight
Include mobility work in your routine
